content:
"If a live cell has 2 neighbours, it does not change."
should be
"If an alive cell has cell has 2 or 3 neighbours, it does not change."

Cells 2;4, 1;2  => could you explain if indexes are row, column or colum, row?
I agree with DeanTheMachine: the real problem here is to recognize the pattern, so I suggest indicating (spoiler) it at the beginning of the text (line 2), for example: in this version, the goal is to identify the outcome of the simulation.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: accept this contribution

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle.  The game of life is not the full puzzle, the pattern recognition is what is the actual problem.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Goal
* Where appropriate, please format the grids using the multi-line monospace syntax, which is 3 backticks ``` before and after the block that needs to be formatted.

* First sentence:
(a) Please add "a" before "cellular".

(b) Please delete "so".

* Second sentence: Please add "a" before "matrix".

* Please change "has an" to "have".

* Please fix the typo: "8 ceils" => "8 cells".

* 8-neighbour example: It seems the "/" character is redundant.

* Please change "it has 3" to "a dead cell has 3".

* Please change "3 neighbour" to "3 neighbours".

* Please change "If cell has" to "If an alive cell has" (twice).

* Please change "lower than 2" to "fewer than 2".

* All the steps
(a) Please change "becomes" to "become" where you are talking about more than one cell.

* Please change "they has" to "they have".

* Would you please also run the rest of the statement through a spell checker and a grammar checker? There are quite a few issues.

Thanks.

Thank you for following up. The statement looks much better now. New comments as follows:

Goal
* Suggest to add "Cells on the sides or at the corners have fewer neighbours." after the 8-neighbour illustration.

* Configuration: Please change "have3" to "have 3".

* Step 1: Please change "so much" to "too many".

* Step 4
(a) Please change "came" to "come".

(b) Please add "the" before "initial".

(c) Please change "shifted" to "has shifted".

(d) Please change "left" to "right".

(e) Please change "hapens" to "happens".

(f) Please change "will reach" to "reaches the".

(g) Please change "3;3" to "3;2".

* Between Step 5 and Step 6 you have skipped a step which should contain 3 living cells only.

* Still: Please change "immovable" to "motionless" or "stationary".

* Oscillator: Please change "it" to "itself".

* Death
(a) Please change "one live" to "living".

(b) Please add "remains" after "cell".

* Oscillator period: Please change "need" to "needed".

* Hint: I don't understand what you're trying to state in the hint. It also looks like you've mentioned those points earlier in the statement. I think the step-by-step walkthrough is sufficient without giving a hint.

Difficulty
* I think the difficulty is more suitably set as "Medium".

Thanks.

Would you please state the reasons for your approval and not just mention that you accept a contribution in the future?

Also, I notice that you've approved 6 contributions in a row. Have you really tried to solve the contributions and write your own solutions before you approve them? Please don't approve them if you have not done so yet.

+1
Came here to comment this after solving it.

But there's a typo, it should be:
"If a live cell has 2 or 3 neighbours, it does not change."
Would you please also revise the title as there is already an existing puzzle with the same name? There will be confusion in the forum when two puzzles share the same name. Thanks.
